Package chess.model.pieces

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.pieces.Piece
chess.model.pieces.Pawn
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
public final class Pawn extends Piece
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Pawn ( ♙ / ♟ ).

In addition to some of the generic behaviors of a Chess piece, a Pawn also:

  1. stores the state of whether it is on its initial two-square advance (i.e. whether it offers en passant capture to the opponent; such Pawn is considered "in passing / en passant" thereinafter);
  2. determines whether it can initiate an en passant capture on an opponent's Pawn;
  3. cannot move backward;
  4. determines if it is eligible for a Pawn Promotion (not implemented).
Movements that may be initiated by a Pawn:
  1. RegularMove: a regular one-square forward advance;
  2. TwoSquareAdvance: a two-square forward advance on the first move;
  3. Capture: diagonally-forward regular captures;
  4. EnPassantCapture: diagonally-forward en passant captures, refer to EnPassantCapture for details.

    • getCandidateMoves

      public chess.util.List<Movement> getCandidateMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
      Computes and returns a list of candidate movements according to the current configuration of the chessboard and the following: 
       ‧ ‧ o ‧ ‧
 ‧ X O X ‧
 ‧ x ♙ x ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧
      where:
      • O is a regular one-square advance;
      • o is the initial two-square advance;
      • X's are a potential capture;
      • x's are EnPassantCapture's, refer to it for details.
      Specified by:
      getCandidateMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The enclosing chessboard.
      Returns:
      A list of safe and unsafe candidate movements.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.
      See Also:
      • TwoSquareAdvance
      • EnPassantCapture

    • isAtAnInitialPosition

      public boolean isAtAnInitialPosition()
      A Pawn may be at its initial position only if it is at rank 2 (White) or 7 (Black).
      Specified by:
      isAtAnInitialPosition in class Piece
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this Pawn is at one of the possible initial positions.

    • isEnPassant

      public boolean isEnPassant()
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this Pawn is "in passing."

    • setEnPassant

      public void setEnPassant(boolean enPassant)
      Sets the boolean flag that indicates whether this Pawn is "in passing."

      This method:

      • does nothing if this Pawn is not eligible for being "in passing," i.e. checks if this Pawn is on rank 4 (White) or 5 (Black);
      • sets the flag to false without any check.
      Parameters:
      enPassant - A new boolean value.

    • isEligibleForPromotion

      public boolean isEligibleForPromotion()
      A Pawn is eligible for Pawn Promotion if and only if it has reached the last rank.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this Pawn is eligible for Pawn Promotion.
